text: The 1991 Arizona Wildcats softball team represented the University of Arizona in the 1991 NCAA Division I softball season. The Wildcats were coached by Mike Candrea, who led his sixth season. The Wildcats finished with a record of 56–16. They competed in the Pacific-10 Conference, where they finished fourth with a 11–9 record. The Wildcats were invited to the 1991 NCAA Division I Softball Tournament, where they swept the West Regional and then completed a run through the Women's College World Series to claim their first NCAA Women's College World Series Championship and first women's team championship in school history. This title would start a run of eight WCWS championships over seventeen seasons and lead to recognition as one of the top programs in the nation. ==Roster== {| class="toccolours" style="border-collapse:collapse; font-size:90%;" |- ! colspan=9 style=""| 1991 Arizona Wildcats roster |- |width="03"| |valign="top"| Pitchers *1 - Susie Parra - Freshman *32 - Debby Day - Junior Catchers *10 - Renee Rosas - Sophomore *15 - Jody Miller - Sophomore |valign="top"| Infielders *3 - Stephanie Salcidio - Junior *4 - Julie Standering - Senior *5 - Susie Duarte - Freshman *7 - Julie Jones - Senior *8 - Marcie Aguilar - Senior *11 - Lisa Guise - Sophomore |width="15"| | valign="top" | Outfielders *2 - Kristin Gauthier - Senior *16 - Teresa Castillo - Freshman *22 - Suzie Lady - Senior *23 - Stacy Redondo - Sophomore *24 - Jamie Heggen - Sophomore |} ==Schedule== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !colspan=2|Legend |- | style="background:#ccffcc;"| ||Arizona win |- | style="background:#fbb;"| ||Arizona loss |- | * ||Non- Conference game |} {| class="toccolours" width=95% style="margin:1.5em auto; text-align:center;" |- ! colspan=2 style=""|1991 Arizona Wildcats Softball Game Log |- ! colspan=2 style=""|Regular Season |- valign="top" | {| class="wikitable collapsible collapsed" style="margin:auto; font-size:95%; width:100%" ! colspan=10 style="padding-left:4em;"|February |- !
